get.description: This web service sends a request to the ping endpoint to see if the server is available. If it fails to respond then either there is an issue with the server being addressed, or there are connection issues on the network reaching out to the server.

This service calculates the gene-variant association for any given pair of gene and variant, which may or may not be significant. This requires as input a GENCODE ID, GTEx variant ID, and tissue site detail ID. By default, the calculation is based on the latest GTEx release.

parameters.description: StringParameter description
parameters.name: gencodeId

parameters.description: Internal variant ID
parameters.name: variantId

parameters.description: Tissue ID of the tissue of interest.
parameters.name: tissueSiteDetailId

parameters.description: Unique identifier of a dataset. Usually includes a data source and data release.
parameters.name: datasetId

post.description: This service calculates the gene-variant association for any given pair of gene and variant, which may or may not be significant. This requires as input a GENCODE ID, GTEx variant ID, and tissue site detail ID. By default, the calculation is based on the latest GTEx release.

parameters.description: The variant ID, gencode ID, and tissue site detail ID we want to calculate and eQTL for.
parameters.name: Test Your Own entry.

get.description: This service returns eGenes (eQTL Genes) from the specified dataset. eGenes are genes that have at least one significant cis-eQTL acting upon them. Results may be filtered by tissue. By default, the service queries the latest GTEx release. Specify a dataset ID to fetch results from a different dataset. For each eGene, the results include the allelic fold change (log2AllelicFoldChange), p-value (pValue), p-value threshold (pValueThreshold), empirical p-value (empiricalPValue), and q-value (qValue). The log2AllelicFoldChange is the allelic fold change (in log2 scale) of the most significant eQTL. The pValue is the nominal p-value of the most significant eQTL. The pValueThreshold is the p-value threshold used to determine whether a cis-eQTL for this gene is considered significant. For more details see https://gtexportal.org/home/documentationPage#staticTextAnalysisMethods. The empiricalPValue is the beta distribution-adjusted empirical p-value from FastQTL. The qValues were calculated based on the empirical p-values. A false discovery rate (FDR) threshold of <= 0.05 was applied to identify genes with a significant eQTL.

parameters.description: Page (slice) of entire results set to return. 0-based.
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Number of records per page of results.  Max is 2000.
parameters.name: pageSize

parameters.description: Filter down results matching the specified term. Used internally by the GTEx portal
parameters.name: searchTerm

parameters.description: Which column in the results should be used for sorting paginated results?
parameters.name: sortBy

parameters.description: Sort direction for the returned data.
parameters.name: sortDirection

parameters.description: Tissue ID of the tissue of interest.
parameters.name: tissueSiteDetailId

parameters.description: Unique identifier of a dataset. Usually includes a data source and data release.
parameters.name: datasetId

get.description: This service returns multi-tissue eQTL Metasoft results for a given gene and variant in a specified dataset. Versioned GENCODE ID and GTEx variant ID must be provided. For each tissue, the results include: m-value (mValue), normalized effect size (nes), p-value (pValue) and standard error (se). The m-value is the posterior probability that an eQTL effect exists in each tissue tested in the cross-tissue meta-analysis  (Han and Eskin, PLoS Genetics 8(3): e1002555, 2012). The normalized effect size is the slope of the linear regression of normalized expression data versus the three genotype categories using single-tissue eQTL analysis, representing eQTL effect size. The p-value is from a t-test that compares observed NES from single-tissue eQTL analysis to a null NES of 0. By default, the service queries the latest GTEx release.

parameters.description: Internal variant ID
parameters.name: variantId

parameters.description: StringParameter description
parameters.name: gencodeId

parameters.description: Unique identifier of a dataset. Usually includes a data source and data release.
parameters.name: datasetId

get.description: This service returns precomputed significant single tissue eQTLs. Results may be filtered by tissue, gene, variant or dataset. To search by gene, use the versioned GENCODE ID (gencodeId) or gene symbol (geneSymbol). To search by variant, use the dbSNP rs ID (snpId) or GTEx variant ID (variantId). By default, the service queries the latest GTEx release.

parameters.name: variantId

parameters.description: Unique identifier of a dataset. Usually includes a data source and data release.
parameters.name: datasetId

get.description: This service returns the collapsed exons in the gene model of the given gene. Gene-level and exon-level expression quantification were based on the GENCODE annotation, collapsed to a single transcript model for each gene using an algorithm developed by the GTEx analysis team. To learn more about the method, visit https://gtexportal.org/home/documentationPage. By default, this service queries the models used by the latest GTEx release.

parameters.description: Versioned GENCODE ID of a gene, e.g. ENSG00000065613.9.
parameters.name: gencodeId

parameters.description: Unique identifier of a dataset. Usually includes a data source and data release.
parameters.name: datasetId

get.summary: Find the collapsed gene model of the given gene.

get.description: This service returns tissue information for a dataset. Information includes tissue IDs, number of RNA-Seq samples, number of RNA-Seq samples with genotype, number of expressed genes, number of eGenes. Also includes tissueSiteDetail ID, name, abbreviation, uberon ID, and standard tissue colors. TissueSiteDetails are grouped by TissueSites. By default, this service reports from the latest GTEx release.

parameters.description: Unique identifier of a dataset. Usually includes a data source and data release.
parameters.name: datasetId

parameters.description: Tissue Site is an anatomical grouping of Tissue Site Details.
parameters.name: tissueSite

parameters.description: Standard abbreviation for the Tissue Site Detail, e.g., ADPSBQ.
parameters.name: tissueSiteDetailAbbr

parameters.description: The URL formatted version of a tissueSiteDetail, e.g., Adipose_Subcutaneous
parameters.name: tissueSiteDetailId

parameters.description: Format of result.
parameters.name: format

get.summary: Fetch tissue information for a dataset.

get.description: This service returns information about a variant, including position, dbSNP RS ID, the reference allele, the alternative allele, and whether the minor allele frequency is >= 1%. For GTEx v6p, there is also information about whether the whole exome sequence and chip sequencing data are available. Results may be queried by GTEx variant ID (variantId), dbSNP RS ID (snpId) or genomic location (chromosome and pos). Variants are identified based on the genotype data of each dataset cohort, namely, are dataset-dependent. Each variant is assigned a unique GTEx variant ID (i.e. the primary key). Not all variants have a mappable dbSNP RS ID. By default, this service queries the latest GTEx release.

parameters.description: Format of result.
parameters.name: format

parameters.description: SNP RS Id.
parameters.name: snpId

parameters.description: Internal variant ID
parameters.name: variantId

parameters.description: Unique identifier of a dataset. Usually includes a data source and data release.
parameters.name: datasetId

parameters.description: Chromosome
parameters.name: chromosome

parameters.description: Genomic position relative to chromosome
parameters.name: pos

get.summary: Find variants by ID or location.

The optional parameter boxplotDetail can be specified to report expression medians and quartiles. By default, this service queries the latest GTEx release.

get.description: This service returns median exon read counts, in tissues, of a collapsed gene model. Results may be filtered by dataset, gene or tissue, but at least one gene must be provided. When the optional parameter hcluster is set to true, the service will return the hierarchical clustering results of tissues, based on exon expression data, in Newick format. The hierarchical clustering is performed by calculating Euclidean distances and using the average linkage method. If hcluster flag is set to true, only JSON format can be returned. By default, this service queries the latest GTEx release.

parameters.description: Unique identifier of a dataset. Usually includes a data source and data release.
parameters.name: datasetId

parameters.description: Versioned GENCODE ID of a gene, e.g. ENSG00000065613.9.
parameters.name: gencodeId

parameters.description: Tissue ID of the tissue of interest.
parameters.name: tissueSiteDetailId

parameters.description: specifies whether or not to perform hierarchical clustering.
parameters.name: hcluster

parameters.description: Format of result.
parameters.name: format

get.description: This service returns median gene expression in tissues. Results may be filtered by dataset, gene or tissue, but at least one gene must be provided. When the optional parameter hcluster is set to true, the service will return the hierarchical clustering results of tissues and genes, based on expression, in Newick format. The hierarchical clustering is performed by calculating Euclidean distances and using the average linkage method. If the hcluster flag is set to true, only JSON format can be returned. By default, this service queries the latest GTEx release.

parameters.description: Unique identifier of a dataset. Usually includes a data source and data release.
parameters.name: datasetId

parameters.description: Versioned GENCODE ID of a gene, e.g. ENSG00000065613.9.
parameters.name: gencodeId

parameters.description: Tissue ID of the tissue of interest.
parameters.name: tissueSiteDetailId

parameters.description: specifies whether or not to perform hierarchical clustering.
parameters.name: hcluster

parameters.description: Format of result.
parameters.name: format

get.description: This service returns median junction read counts in tissues of a given gene from all known transcripts. Results may be filtered by dataset or tissue. When the optional parameter hcluster is set to true, the service will return the hierarchical clustering results of tissues, based on junction expression, in Newick format. The hierarchical clustering is performed by calculating Euclidean distances and using the average linkage method. If the hcluster flag is set to true, only JSON format can be returned. By default, this service queries the latest GTEx release.

parameters.description: Unique identifier of a dataset. Usually includes a data source and data release.
parameters.name: datasetId

parameters.description: Versioned GENCODE ID of a gene, e.g. ENSG00000065613.9.
parameters.name: gencodeId

parameters.description: Tissue ID of the tissue of interest.
parameters.name: tissueSiteDetailId

parameters.description: specifies whether or not to perform hierarchical clustering.
parameters.name: hcluster

parameters.description: Format of result.
parameters.name: format

get.description: This service returns median normalized expression in tissues of all known transcripts of a given gene. Results may be filtered by dataset or tissue. When the optional parameter hcluster is set to true, the service will return the hierarchical clustering results of tissues and transcripts, based on expression, in Newick format. The hierarchical clustering is performed by calculating Euclidean distances and using the average linkage method. If the hcluster flag is set to true, only JSON format can be returned. By default, this service queries the latest GTEx release.

parameters.description: Unique identifier of a dataset. Usually includes a data source and data release.
parameters.name: datasetId

parameters.description: Versioned GENCODE ID of a gene, e.g. ENSG00000065613.9.
parameters.name: gencodeId

parameters.description: Tissue ID of the tissue of interest.
parameters.name: tissueSiteDetailId

parameters.description: specifies whether or not to perform hierarchical clustering.
parameters.name: hcluster

parameters.description: Format of result.
parameters.name: format

get.summary: Find median transcript expression data of all known transcripts of a gene.

get.description: This service returns exons from all known transcripts of the given gene. A versioned GENCODE ID is required to ensure that all exons are from a single gene. A dataset ID or both GENCODE version and genome build must be provided. Although annotated exons are not dataset dependent, specifying a dataset here is equivalent to specifying the GENCODE version and genome build used by that dataset.

parameters.description: Versioned GENCODE ID of a gene, e.g. ENSG00000065613.9.
parameters.name: gencodeId

parameters.description: GENCODE annotation release.
parameters.name: gencodeVersion

parameters.description: Reference genome assembly.
parameters.name: genomeBuild

parameters.description: Unique identifier of a dataset. Usually includes a data source and data release.
parameters.name: datasetId

get.summary: Find exons from all known reference transcripts of the given gene.

get.description: This service returns information about reference genes. A genome build and GENCODE version must be provided. Genes are searchable by gene symbol, GENCODE ID and versioned GENCODE ID. Versioned GENCODE ID is recommended to ensure unique ID matching. By default, this service queries the genome build and GENCODE version used by the latest GTEx release.

parameters.description: A gene symbol, versioned gencodeId, or unversioned gencodeId.
parameters.name: geneId

parameters.description: GENCODE annotation release.
parameters.name: gencodeVersion

parameters.description: Reference genome assembly.
parameters.name: genomeBuild

parameters.description: Page (slice) of entire results set to return. 0-based.
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Number of records per page of results.  Max is 2000.
parameters.name: pageSize

parameters.description: Format of result.
parameters.name: format

parameters.description: GENCODE annotation release.

parameters.description: Reference genome assembly.

parameters.description: Unique identifier of a dataset. Usually includes a data source and data release.

get.summary: Find all transcripts of a reference gene.
